title: Unequal Pay for Equal Work: The Gender Gap in Academic Medicine

Such discrimination is not unique to the world of high finance. Things seem to be much worse in medicine. In June 2004, the U.S. Census Bureau released an analysis of the earnings of full-time workers that reported that female physicians' wages averaged 63 cents for every dollar earned by their male colleagues (2).
